intro: Otanthera queenslandica, commonly known as the Queensland aster, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and has adapted to withstand salty air and coastal winds. Otanthera queenslandica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
